item.title: Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga â€“ The Best Planets, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga offers a massive galaxy to explore across all nine episodes, making it the biggest LEGO title yet.
  • Some planets like Mustafar and Bespin have more secrets and quests, providing a sense of scale and variety to players.
  • Coruscant, Tatooine, and other iconic Star Wars planets offer a mix of impressive sights, challenging puzzles, and rewarding collectibles.

LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga gives players a massive galaxy to explore across all nine Star Wars episodes. Therefore, it goes without saying that the game is bigger than any LEGO title thus far. Numerous planets lie at players' fingertips, daring them to explore their exotic sights and unique challenges.

Certain worlds are more fun than others, though. The more enticing ones tend to have more secrets and quests, spreading these activities over multiple levels and hammering home the sense of scope. Players will quickly find that among The Skywalker Saga 's many pastimes is finding those planets with the most to offer.

Updated on August 11, 2024, by Jake Fillery: As LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga heads to the hands of PS Plus owners for free, some new players might want to take a look at the sprawling and iconic Star Wars planets that feature in LEGO format, providing players with some exciting exploration potential to unlock further goodies and familiarize themselves with some nostalgic areas from the best Star Wars movies.

10 Mustafar

A Volcanic Hellpscape, Where Anakin Skywalker Truly Became Darth Vader

  • Kyber Bricks: 23
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters: 2
  • Unlockable Ships: 2

Whilst Mustafar isn't the nicest place to visit on account of the tragic yet epic battle of heroes between Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi, it's still fun to see the sights that took part in their duel. Mustafar is a hellscape, where volcanoes, lava, and ash reign supreme in unhospitable environments, meaning that the Mining Complex players visit is pretty small.

Mustafar is worth a visit for its assortment of collectibles, which will challenge players who attempt to grab them without succumbing to Anakin's fate. On top of the cool area from an iconic moment, players will be able to listen to one of the best tracks, Anakin's Dark Deeds by John Williams, on repeat.

9 Kamino

The Aquatic Planet Where Kaminoans Create Clones For The Grand Republic

  • Kyber Bricks: 15
  • Datashards: 0
  • Unlockable Characters: 5
  • Unlockable Ships: 1

Venturing to Tipoca City is going to feel like a nice break from the mayhem, as this fresh spot on Kamino is adorned with lovely architecture and a sophisticated society of Kaminoans that want no violence. Kamino is peaceful, which makes it nice to explore and look at all the cool bits of lore with the cloning facilities that use Jango Fett's DNA.

It's fun to see clones created, and walking around Kamino before they ship out to become soldiers in a galaxy-spanning war. There aren't a lot of collectibles in Kamino, but there is an assortment of fun ways to obtain them, and the peaceful nature of the small area makes it worth visiting.

8 Dagobah

The Swamp Planet That Thrives With Creatures and the Force, and Yoda's Place of Exile

  • Kyber Bricks: 15
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters: 2
  • Unlockable Ships: 1

Dagobah is one of the smaller planets found in the game, but it's still pretty exciting. There are some challenging puzzles, and the game really doesn't hold players' hands when trying to solve them. There is a constant threat of creatures like swamp snakes and other beasts that will lurk out of the water for surprise attacks, making Dagobah a rather unfriendly planet to visit, but still interesting.

Dagobah houses Yoda's cute little hut, so immersing in this planet of exile is a pretty fun way to experience the game. Dragonsnake Bog may not be the biggest area in the game, but Yoda has already proved once before that size matters not.

7 Bespin

Interesting Interiors On Cloud City Showcase Engineering That Floats

  • Kyber Bricks: 23
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters:5
  • Unlockable Ships: 3

Lando Calrissian's city is just as glamorous as its ruler. It may not look like much at first, but beneath the elevated paths lies a colossal courtyard with countless collectibles and quests. The beautiful sunset lighting only makes it more picturesque. It's easy to see why so many people flock here.

Sadly, that glamour fades somewhat once players enter the buildings. The simplistic, snow-white hallways are a bit of an eyesore, though not nearly enough to dampen the splendor of the exterior. They say it's what's on the inside that matters, but it's the opposite with Cloud City.

6 Yavin 4

A Forest Moon That Was Once a Jedi Temple

  • Kyber Bricks: 26
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters: 5
  • Unlockable Ships: 3

This forest moon is technically not a planet, but it's just as recognizable among the Star Wars fan base. Upon landing, players are greeted by the massive pyramidal temple, challenging them to reach the top. Inside lies the hustle and bustle of the Rebel Alliance--stretched across three floors, each more filled with goodies than the last. It doesn't end there, though.

The surrounding ruins also hold a few secrets. Amid the exoticism are additional puzzles to solve and bounty hunters to battle. Whenever the side quests send players out here, it's hard not to feel like another Rebel fighter, scouting a hostile area to secure the base. This is an unexpected-yet-welcome bit of immersion most people likely don't look for in a LEGO game.

5 Naboo

The Underwater Gungan City Pairs Well With the Glory of Theed

  • Kyber Bricks: 53
  • Datashards: 0
  • Unlockable Characters: 8
  • Unlockable Ships: 3

This is among the prettier and more peaceful planets. That's immediately clear upon entering the underwater Gungan city. This otherworldly hub is rife with puzzles, calling for precise traversal of the narrow walkways and bubble-shaped rooms. Ascending to the surface yields an even more striking sight.

Players can then bask in the glory of Theed. The royal city has gorgeous architecture right out of the Italian Renaissance. Unfortunately, there's not much variety in that architecture. Most buildings look the same, and they have limited means of climbing and navigation compared to other cityscapes. As artists say, "Look, but don't touch."

4 Cantonica

A Castle Town Rife With Gambling

  • Kyber Bricks: 35
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters: 4
  • Unlockable Ships: 1

How ironic that one of the series' worst sequences makes for one of the most striking worlds here. That success comes from showcasing everything except the casino. Canto Bight is a classical castle town akin to Bradford-on-Avon, with the moody candlelight giving it a vague Final Fantasy flavor on top of that. Players can spend hours wandering the maze of pathways and alleys before ever reaching the main gambling hub.

Thankfully, this is not nearly as noisy or obnoxious as the movie. Rather, it's a smooth nightclub with goodies both out in the open and behind closed doors. These elements ensure Cantonica doesn't capture the experience of the film but improves on it.

3 Kashyyyk

The Homeworld of the Wookiees, Sprawling With Jungles

  • Kyber Bricks: 26
  • Datashards: 1
  • Unlockable Characters: 2
  • Unlockable Ships: 1

This is the home of the tree-dwelling Wookiees. As such, they have a village atop the massive trees like the Ewoks on Endor. Players can go in and around the dense vegetation. Unlike Endor, however, the planet isn't limited to this.

The ground is just as enticing on Kashyyyk. Fans can comb the beach for kyber bricks or run through the riverside woods, freeing the furballs from oppressive clone troopers. The environment isn't as packed as others, but nor does it feel empty of worthwhile content. It goes to show that even the more remote planets of this sci-fi franchise are worth visiting.

2 Coruscant

The Grand Republic's Capitol, A Literal City-Wide Planet

  • Kyber Bricks: 67
  • Datashards: 2
  • Unlockable Characters: 16
  • Unlockable Ships: 4

The movies describe the Republic capital as a city that encompasses the whole planet, and every city has several sides. The Federal District on the upper level is as impressive as you'd expect in its massive scope. It looks simple in terms of navigation, yet the collectibles call for creativity to access. Nearly everything--from climbing the massive sculptures to just getting into the rooms of the huge Senate hub--requires some problem-solving. Thankfully, these feats always yield rewards.

On the other hand, it's relatively easy to access the imposing Jedi Temple. The downside is that this locale is somewhat barren of useful items.

The street level of the Uscru District more than makes up for that. The grungy buildings and neon lights give off a cyberpunk vibe, and the unfriendly alleys are teeming with puzzles to solve and quests to take on. In the end, Coruscant's variety is matched only by its density.

1 Tatooine

The Sand Planet That Started it All

  • Kyber Bricks: 100
  • Datashards: 3
  • Unlockable Characters: 25
  • Unlockable Ships: 3

The saga's most popular and recurring planet, Tatooine obviously gets plenty of attention from the developers. The sprawling openness of the Jundland Wastes is a sight to behold, especially after scaling the towering cliffs for secrets. Those pursuing the right-side quest can even fight a massive krayt dragon.

For a change in scenery, you can then travel to the two major towns. Mos Espa is the more crowded of the two, due to both the taller buildings and podracing popularity. Mos Eisley, on the other hand, is just as dangerous as one expects. Mercs and crooks prowl the wider streets, and they only grow harder to avoid upon entering the famous cantina. For as bleak as it is, the iconography immortalized in sci-fi cinema is done ample justice here.

item.title: Fallout Shelter: 9 Best Outfits For Exploring The Wasteland
item.description:
Fallout Shelter is a cross-platform game based on the Fallout franchise. Released in 2015, it is available to play for free. Initially perceived as a novelty, the game was more of a marketing tool for Fallout 4 than a comprehensive gaming experience. However, it has evolved over the years into a live service game with a substantial and dedicated fan base.

An integral aspect of gameplay in Fallout Shelter involves sending dwellers out to explore wasteland locations. Before dispatching them, dwellers must be leveled up and equipped with suitable gear, and the gear the player equips a dweller with includes a suitable outfit. There are a number of outfits in the game that suit wasteland exploration and questing better than others.

Updated on August 11, 2024, by Mac Wheeler: There have been a handful of updates to Fallout Shelter. As part of these updates, some additional items were added to the game, and this includes some useful outfits for wasteland exploration. The best of these have been added to the ranking.

9 T-45f Power Armor

Solid Ranged Damage Armor

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +2 Strength, +5 Perception
  • Value : 500
  • Crafting requirements:
    • Wonderglue x 4
    • Giddyup Buttercup x 3
    • Military Circuit Board x 2

The T-45f Power Armor is one of a series of power armors with the T-45 designation. Each of these is subtly different, with slightly different stats. However, the T-45f variant is the best of the bunch. This is not the kind of armor that a player would want to equip on a vault dweller that has low innate endurance, as it has no endurance bonus baked in.

However, for vault dwellers with good endurance, the T-45f Power Armor adds a whopping 5 perception. This means that it is perfect for equipping alongside a high-damage ranged weapon. But its main benefit in wasteland exploration is that high perception means finding more loot.

8 T-60f Power Armor

And Upgrade Over The T-45f Power Armor

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +1 Strength, +1 Perception, +5 Endurance
  • Value : 500
  • Crafting requirements:
    • Wonderglue x 4
    • Giddyup Buttercup x 3
    • Military Circuit Board x 2

As with the T-45f Power Armor above, the T-60f Power Armor is the best of the power armors with the T-60 designation. It has exactly the same crafting requirements as the T-45f, so it should be prioritized for crafting over the lesser armor., but only if it is intended for use to equip a vault dweller that already has high innate perceptions.

The T-60f Power Armor adds a lot of survivability to a vault dweller that doesnâ€™t have very much endurance. The +5 to this stat adds a lot of health points. It has additional benefits for wasteland exploration though. High endurance means finding more legendary junk, and it also adds some radiation mitigation as well. Overall, the T-60f Power Armor makes a great outfit for vault dwellers who are heading out into the wasteland to explore, although there are better options.

7 Wilzig's Travelwear

Added In A Recent Update

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses: +4 Perception, +2 Endurance, +2 Agility, +4 Luck
  • Value : 500
  • Crafting requirements:
    • Wonderglue x 4
    • Chemistry Flask x 3
    • Brahmin Hide x 3

Wilzig's Travelwear is one of the newer outfits available to players in Fallout Shelter. It was added as part of the 1.18.0 update. It is an interesting outfit and could be great for wasteland exploration but with a caveat. It will need to be used by a vault dweller who already has a fair bit of endurance, simply to make sure they survive their adventures.

What makes Wilzig's Travelwear is firstly, the fact it adds 4 perception, which gives the dweller more chance of discovering loot while exploring. And secondly, the +4 luck, which increases the chance of a dweller finding legendary junk and bottle caps. For the right vault dweller, Wilzig's Travelwear could be an excellent outfit, turning them into a loot monster while exploring the wasteland in Fallout Shelter.

6 Heavy Wasteland Gear

The Fallout Shelter Hazmat Suit

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +7 Endurance
  • Value : 500

Crafting requirements:

  • Globe x 4
  • Yao Guai Hide x 3
  • Chemistry Flask x 2

The best thing about using Heavy Wasteland Gear to equip vault dwellers who are heading out into the wasteland is that it completely negates damage from radiation. In effect, that makes this a hazmat suit that can be used by both male and female vault dwellers.

With the +7 Endurance bonus, a fully leveled-up vault dweller with their Endurance stat trained to 10 will have the maximum amount of health possible. This is an excellent outfit to make sure that a dweller has the highest possible survivability when exploring the wasteland. As long as the dweller is happy when sent out to the wasteland, they will have a good chance of surviving.

5 War's Armor

Great For The Stat Boosts

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +4 Strength, Perception, Endurance, and Charisma
  • Value : 500

Warâ€™s Armor is a Power Armor suit that provides a vault dweller with some solid stat boosts when equipped. For general use, sending a dweller into the wasteland, and for quests, the combination of Strength and Perception boosting damage, and Endurance boosting survivability, is just about perfect.

Warâ€™s Armor is one of the possible quest rewards from the "Horsemen of the Post-Apocalypse" questline, so whether the player has access to this armor or not comes down to the RNG roll on quest completion. However, if players are lucky enough to get this outfit as a reward, it will become a solid part of their vault dweller loadout for exploration in the wasteland, and for battling wasteland creatures.

4 Pestilence's Plating

An Alternative To Warâ€™s Armor

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +4 Endurance, Charisma, Agility, and Intelligence
  • Value : 500

Pestilence's Plating is another one of the armor sets in Fallout Shelter that is given as a quest reward for completing the "Horsemen of the Post-Apocalypse" series of quests. Warâ€™s Armor was covered in the previous section, and Pestilence's Plating is another solid outfit option. Its stat boosts are more suited to wasteland exploration when the player wants to ensure the vault dweller has the best chance of survival.

This is also an excellent armor set for leveling up vault dwellers out in the wasteland, due to its bonus to Intelligence. This means the dweller will receive more EXP for every type of action they perform while out exploring.

3 Detective Outfit

Great For Wasteland Exploration

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Male
  • Stat Bonuses : +4 Perception, Endurance, Luck, and Intelligence
  • Value : 500

Oddly, the Detective Outfit is a great piece of equipment to use for wasteland exploration in Fallout Shelter . Rather than boosting stats related to combat and survivability, the Detective Outfit boosts stats that help a vault dweller avoid some encounters altogether, and achieve better outcomes in some activities.

With Luck and Intelligence boosted, this outfit is great for improving loot drop chance, and ensuring that the vault dweller is getting the maximum number of experience points possible when completing actions out in the wasteland. The extra Endurance is useful too, as it lowers the amount of damage a dweller takes from radiation. Overall, this is a solid wasteland exploration outfit that players can get lots of value out of.

2 Mutant Hunter Gear

Craftable With Damage Bonuses

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +4 Strength, +3 Perception
  • Value : 500

Crafting requirements:

  • Microscope x 5
  • Teddy Bear x 4

The Mutant Hunter Gear takes second place on this list, even though it doesnâ€™t have as good stat bonuses as some of the previous entries. However, what makes the Mutant Hunter Gear a really good outfit, is the fact it is easy to craft and available very early in the game.

As a basic outfit to be used in early-game wasteland exploration, this is going to be the go-to choice for most players of Fallout Shelter . Later in the game, the player will gain access to more advanced outfits, but until then, the Mutant Hunter Gear is a fantastic option.

1 X-01 Mk VI PA

Fantastic Mid-Game Craftable Outfit

  • Rarity : Legendary
  • Sex : Unisex
  • Stat Bonuses : +5 Strength, +1 Perception, and +1 Endurance
  • Value : 500

Crafting requirements:

  • Wonderglue x 4
  • Giddyup Buttercup x 3
  • Military Circuit Board x 2

The X-01 Mk VI PA outfit can be crafted by Fallout Shelter players. It doesnâ€™t have as good of stats as some of the quest reward outfits, but the fact that it's easy to craft and available long before the player will gain access to the advanced outfits is why it takes the top spot on this list. For general exploration and fighting creatures, it offers the game's best value.

With its respectable boosts to damage output and survivability, this is the outfit that most players will be using to level up their vault dwellers out in the wasteland. Yes, there are better outfits on paper, but none of them can be crafted in bulk and used to outfit whole teams of vault dwellers for exploration.

item.title: The Best Local Co-Op & Split-Screen Strategy Games, Ranked
item.description:
Strategy games are typically slower, more intricate affairs than most other video game genres. However, that is not to say that they can't be enjoyed with other players. In fact, competing against other human players for strategic domination is one of the genre's most engaging systems.

Yet, competitive multiplayer is not always the best way to play titles in the strategy genre. By playing strategy titles cooperatively, especially crouched around a local gaming setup, dynamic alliances can brew from the chaos of the strategic fallout.

9 Sid Meyer's Civilization VI

A Strategy Giant Allowing For Cooperative 4X Fun

For more than 30 years, Sid Meyer's Civilization series has taught gamers about historical societies, engaged them with diplomatic conundrums, and showcased the destruction of continental warfare.

With a healthy dose of communication, the 4X world of Civilization VI can be carved out between friendly local players. On PC and console, 'hot seat' multiplayer allows gamers to play on the same screen and tackle each era together. Players can trade, ally, and defend one another to achieve victory over AI and other human players.

8 Pit People

A Cult-Classic Indie Take On Coop Turn-Based Combat

Although the name The Behemoth may not be familiar to all gamers, this development studio's influential indie titles are sure to be. In creating titles such as Alien Hominid , Castle Crashers , and Battleblock Theatre , they have carved out a unique style and aesthetic for their games.

Their 2018 turn-based strategy title Pit People combined their off-the-wall comedy and a pseudo-randomized combat system to create a unique experience. Players can share the same screen against a common enemy â€” or, of course, go head-to-head against one another.

7 Tooth and Tail

An Anthromorphic RTS With Real-Time Cooperation

  • Platform(s): PC, PlayStation 4
  • Developer : Pocketwatch Games
  • Genre(s): Real-time Strategy
  • Released: September 12, 2017

A genre that does not easily allow itself to be played cooperatively is that of the real-time strategy title. This is mostly due to the technical power required to allow for two instances of the game to be played at the same time.

However, Pocketwatch Games' 2017 game Tooth and Tail pulls off their anthropomorphic take on the genre with both local and online cooperative play. In this Animal Farm -esque revolutionary tale, players control particular commanders, rather than taking direct control over every individual unit.

6 The Escapists 2

A Tactical RPG WIth Cooperative Multiplayer At Its Forefront

Of all aspects of the original Escapists title, Team 17 sought to incorporate one major update to their top-down RPG-strategy game: multiplayer. However, due to the 2015 game's code hindering a multiplayer update, a full-blown sequel was created with this focus.

As such, up to three players can play Escapists 2 through its handy drop-in, drop-out multiplayer system. Gamers can work together to scout out more of their prison's architecture and loot more resources, making escaping even more of a seamless task than before.

5 Defense Grid 2

Tower Defense With A Focus On Communication and Cooperation

  • Platform(s): PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch
  • Developer: Hidden Path Entertainment
  • Genre(s): Tower Defense
  • Released: September 23, 2014

Defense Grid 2's tower-defense genre is unique in that it not only allows for cooperative play, but ultimately encourages a cooperative mindset.

While players will still work together to defend a host of space stations and intergalactic colonies from the alien horde, resources and buildable squares are shared between all participants. As such, if one player is saving for an ultimately superior upgrade or unit, gamers are required to communicate and cooperate to allow for a smooth gameplay experience.

4 For the King

A Tabletop Title That Excels When Played Cooperatively

For the King's 2018 full release not only brought with it a uniquely stylized tabletop strategy-RPG experience, but also allowed players to share it with others.

While the title is perfectly manageable through solo play, the classes, attributes, and cosmetics mean that every adventurer feels like their own individual character. Splitting up the group to tackle antagonistic forces, or to rest up and barter for goods, is enjoyable playing solo, but is bolstered by a local or online group of real-life companions. â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

3 Pikmin 3: Deluxe

A Nintendo Re-Release Introducing Campaign Coop

  • Platform(s): Nintendo Switch
  • Developer: Nintendo EAD, Nintendo EPD, Eighting
  • Genre(s): Real-time Strategy, Action
  • Released: October 30, 2020

With Pikmin 3's focus on splitting up the central cast of pint-sized explorers to cover more ground each day, the much-loved Wii U title's multiplayer elements seemed specially designed for a cooperative experience. However, despite some cooperative-exclusive challenge modes, no story co-op ultimately arrived at the 2013 title.

Yet, with the game's 2020 enhanced port to the Nintendo Switch console, a local campaign coop was introduced. As such, the entirety of Pikmin 3's miniature multitasking became available to play with a friend. â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

2 Worms 2: Armageddon

A Return To Series' Roots That Reinvigorates Cooperative Play

  • Platform(s): Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, iOS, Android
  • Developer: Team 17
  • Genre(s): Artillery, Strategy
  • Released: July 1, 2009

Originally released as an Xbox Live Arcade title before becoming available on iOS, Android, and PlayStation 3, Worms 2: Armageddon's 'hot seat' local co-op and PVP multiplayer ranks as one of the most acclaimed in the entire franchise's history.

A sequel to Team 17's 2007 Xbox Live Arcade Worms title, which returned to the series' 2D roots, this turn-based 2D tactics title is just as explosive and extravagant as older titles in the series.

1 Kingdom: Two Crowns

A Slow-Paced Strategy Title Played Best With A Companion

2018's Kingdom Two Crowns excels in so many genres. It is simultaneously a city management system, a tower defense game, and a strategy title. Raw Fury also bolstered the game's release by incorporating local and online multiplayer.

In this 2D sidescrolling strategy title, players are required to balance allocating resources to both defensive ends of their settlements. However, while solo players will have to micromanage both sides of an ever-expanding town, cooperative play allows a division of the stressful yet rewarding workload.

item.title: The Elder Scrolls 6 Has The Perfect Date to Kill Two Birds With One Stone
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bethesda admitted it revealed The Elder Scrolls 6 too soon, causing fan anticipation and speculation to dwindle over the years.
  • June 10, 2025 could be the day Bethesda finally provides an update on the game, reigniting excitement for the long-awaited sequel.
  • With pressure mounting on developers, fans hope for gameplay footage and a release date, but understand the need for patience.

It has now been six long years since Bethesda revealed the announcement trailer for The Elder Scrolls 6 . Unfortunately, that trailer wasn't much of a reveal, at all. The sneak peek of The Elder Scrolls 6 is a mere 37-second-long snippet that features an overhead view of a mountain-lined landscape and the game's logo. Having that short of a trailer six years later has been agonizing for many who love The Elder Scrolls .

Bethesda is no stranger to taking its time in production, and although that can help guarantee a satisfying finished product, the announcement arrived a little too soon. Todd Howard himself has even admitted in the past that he and Bethesda were too quick to reveal the game, as the trailer drummed up a lot more hype than intended. When the first trailer for The Elder Scrolls 6 dropped, the project was still in its infancy, and there have yet to be any more significant updates. However, next year presents the perfect chance for Bethesda to make up for lost time.

The Elder Scrolls 6 Has the Perfect Chance to Reconcile Such a Long Wait

A Specific Date Can Have a Brand-New Meaning

The date of June 10, 2018 now lives on in infamy as the day The Elder Scrolls 6 's announcement trailer was revealed to the masses. Since then, an onslaught of rumors and theories about The Elder Scrolls 6 have appeared on the internet. From the game's setting to its story, Bethesda's long-awaited Skyrim follow-up has had many foaming at the mouth for an inkling of confirmation.

However, June 10 could get an all-new meaning next year. Bethesda takes its dates seriously, and 2025 could present the developer with the opportunity to give June 10 a fresh meaning by revealing the next update on the same day it first announced the game. There are a variety of ways a new update could be handled. Whether through a new full-length trailer, a showcase, or even just a confirmation of the game's deeper plot would be something meaningful for those who have been waiting for the next chapter in The Elder Scrolls franchise.

The best-case scenario would be for Bethesda to reveal an official release date for The Elder Scrolls 6 , but any news would be good news at this point. With Todd Howard's admission that Bethesda broke the news too soon, it's likely that the studio is making sure that the time is absolutely right for a fresh update, and June 10 would offer the perfect stage to make that announcement.

Reigniting Excitement For The Elder Scrolls 6

The Flame of The Elder Scrolls 6 is Beginning to Dim

It's been a pretty good year for Bethesda. With Starfield improving and the immense success of Amazon Prime's Fallout streaming series revamping interest in the games, The Elder Scrolls 6 is in need of a kick as well. All the waiting and speculation has begun to take some of the wind out of the game's sails. There is still plenty of anticipation, but the fervor is quickly beginning to dissipate, and Bethesda needs to keep all of its franchises afloat with excitement.

As of now, the future of The Elder Scrolls 6 is uncertain, but June 10, 2025 could be the chance for Bethesda to right its own wrongs. Gameplay footage and a release date would be ideal, but only if the game is truly ready to reveal more footage. Game development is no easy task, and the pressure developers are feeling must be immense, so that also needs to be considered. The Elder Scrolls 6 will reveal itself when the time is right, but that will hopefully be sooner rather than later.

item.title: Clash Royale: How to Counter the Evo Goblin Cage
item.description:
Every time a new Evo gets announced in Clash Royale , people half-expect it to be downright broken. Thankfully, with Evo Goblin Cage , the developers broke the trend and gave us a card that feels powerful, but not to the level that it becomes impossible to play against.

That being said, mid-ladder menaces can still make life difficult for free-to-play players with their Evo Goblin Cage in lower trophies. When people donâ€™t know how to counter this card, it can stop big beatdown meta decks by itself. Of course, once you know the counters, you should have an easier time winning against the Evo Goblin Cage in Clash Royale .

Clash Royale: Evo Goblin Cage Overview

The Evo Goblin Cage is unlocked just like any other Evolution card in Clash Royale: by using Evolution Shards. Itâ€™s a one-cycle Evolution, meaning youâ€™ll get it every other time you play the Goblin Cage.

The card has a unique effect where it grabs and pulls an enemy troop inside the cage and starts eating away at its HP. During this time, the unit that the Goblin Cage pulled in disappears from the arena.

However, the Goblin Cage can only pull one unit inside the arena, and if the unit has any special ability, like the Electro Giantâ€™s reflected damage, it will still damage the cage. Furthermore, the Goblin Cage can pull in only one unit at a time. If the enemy has Elite Barbarians walking down the lane, then the Evo Goblin Cage will only pull in one of the Elite Barbarians while the other one will be able to hit the cage and take it out. It's one of the biggest counters to most Hog Rider decks, since the Hog Rider usually runs in as a solo troop.

Similar to the normal Goblin Cage, once the Evo Goblin Cage dies, itâ€™ll leave behind a Goblin Brawler, only this time, itâ€™ll also be an evolved version of the Brawler with more HP.

Countering The Evo Goblin Cage

When youâ€™re building up a push, you should already have plenty of troops on the board that can take out the Evo Goblin Cage if itâ€™s unprotected. Swarm cards or cards with multiple units can typically destroy the Evo Goblin Cage on its own. Since Evo Goblin Cage only targets ground troops, air cards also work well against it. Cycle decks in Clash Royale tend to do well against this card, since you can out-cycle it pretty easily.

Like the common cards, you want to pair your ranged rare units with a frontline to tank damage from the Evo Goblin Brawler once the Goblin Cage is destroyed. Rocket can take out the Evo Goblin Cage at a -3 elixir trade, so itâ€™s not really worth it. Earthquake is a better alternative if you want to counter the card with a spell.

Princess is arguably the best counter to Evo Goblin Cage , since she can take it out from your side of the arena. Then again, most of the Legendary cards in Clash Royale , other than Sparky, struggle to take out the Evo Goblin Brawler.

Among Champion Cards, both Little Prince and Archer Queen are pretty reliable at taking down both the Evo Goblin Cage and the Evo Goblin Brawler. Skeleton King only counters the card if you manage to pop the ability before walking into the capture range of Evo Goblin Cage.

While it may seem like a tough card to counter at first glance, there are plenty of cards that can play around the Evo Goblin Cage. Itâ€™s not as broken as some of the other Evo cards that weâ€™ve seen so far, but itâ€™s still a strong evolution card that can add extra dimension when building your Clash Royale decks.
